thread.title: Frost keeps cool on Chong Wei issue
thread.title_full: Frost keeps cool on Chong Wei issue

title: Frost keeps cool on Chong Wei issue
text:
Wednesday, 8 February 2017 | MYT 2:46 PM Frost keeps cool on Chong Wei issue 
KUALA LUMPUR: Morten Frost has refused to be drawn into a war of words with World No. 1 badminton player Datuk Lee Chong Wei. 
The BAM technical director on Wednesday said that it was best if he reserved his comments for now. 
Chong Wei, the World No. 1 badminton player, had said on Tuesday that he was ready to quit BAM after sustaining a knee injury after slipping on a court mat at the newly-opened Academy Badminton Malaysia in Bukit Kiara over the weekend. 
Chong Wei had reportedly said that he had lost patience with Frost. 
Asked about his relationship with Chong Wei, Frost said that it was "hard to say" from his point of view. 
He also said that he was not in charge of the mats at the new training ground, noting that there were no other injuries reported there. 
Frost said the atmosphere at the training ground was good and training was going on well. 
"I think everyone is training hard so I have no objections. It's fine," he said. 
The very frosty relationship between the two boiled over on Tuesday with Chong Wei saying he’s ready to quit BAM. 
And the straw that broke the camel’s back was the knee injury that Chong Wei suffered when he slipped and fell at the newly-opened Academy Badminton Malaysia in Bukit Kiara on Saturday. 
That has ruled him out of next month's All-England competition.
